justification: com.google.gson.interceptors has Ce=3 and Ca=0 => instability I = 0/(0+3) = 0.0 (completely unstable). Its outgoing dependencies are: com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12 => I = 12/(12+5) = 0.7059), com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8 => I = 8/(8+2) = 0.8), and com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9 => I = 9/(9+1) = 0.9). All dependent packages have higher stability indices than com.google.gson.interceptors, and there are no incoming dependencies (Ca=0). Therefore the package does not depend on less stable components and does not exhibit the Unstable Dependency smell.

The package has Ce=0 (no outgoing dependencies) and Ca=1 (one incoming dependency), yielding stability I = 1.0. It does not depend on any other packages, so it cannot depend on less stable components. The only referenced package is com.google.gson.internal.bind (incoming, Ce=6, Ca=2), which depends on this util package rather than the util depending on it. Therefore Unstable Dependency is not present.

No unstable dependency detected: the package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce = 0, outgoing_dependencies = []) and no incoming dependencies (Ca = 0, incoming_dependencies = []), so it does not depend on less-stable packages and does not violate the Stable Dependencies Principle.

Target instability I = Ce/(Ce+Ca) = 3/(3+1) = 0.75 (unstable). Outgoing dependencies: com.google.gson I = 5/(5+12) ≈ 0.294, com.google.gson.stream I = 2/(2+8) = 0.20, com.google.gson.reflect I = 1/(1+9) = 0.10. All outgoing dependencies have lower instability (are more stable) than com.google.gson.internal.sql, so the package does not depend on less stable components and thus does not exhibit the Unstable Dependency smell. Note: com.google.gson (I ≈ 0.294) depends on this package (I = 0.75), which means a more stable package depends on a less stable one and may be a risk, but per the given definition the smell (depending on less stable components) is not present for com.google.gson.internal.sql.

com.google.gson.graph has Ce=4 and Ca=0 -> stability I = 0/(0+4) = 0.0 (very unstable). Its outgoing dependencies are more stable: com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12 -> I=12/17 ≈ 0.706), com.google.gson.internal (Ce=5, Ca=6 -> I=6/11 ≈ 0.545), com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8 -> I=8/10 = 0.8), com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9 -> I=9/10 = 0.9). All referenced packages have higher stability than com.google.gson.graph, and there are no incoming dependencies to com.google.gson.graph. Therefore the package does not depend on less stable packages and does not exhibit the Unstable Dependency smell.

com.example has Ce=2, Ca=0 (instability I = 2/(2+0) = 1.0). Its outgoing dependencies: com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12, I = 5/(5+12) = 0.294) and com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9, I = 1/(1+9) = 0.100). Both outgoing packages have lower instability (are more stable) than com.example, so the Stable Dependencies Principle is respected and there is no Unstable Dependency smell.

Outgoing dependencies and their instability: com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9, I=0.10), com.google.gson.internal (Ce=5, Ca=6, I≈0.45), com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12, I≈0.29), com.google.gson.internal.bind.util (Ce=0, Ca=1, I=0.00), com.google.gson.internal.reflect (Ce=2, Ca=2, I=0.50), com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8, I=0.20). Analyzed package metrics: Ce=3, Ca=0 -> Stability S_pkg = 3/(3+0) = 1.0 (highly unstable). Outgoing dependencies and their stabilities: com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12 -> S=5/(5+12)=0.294), com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8 -> S=0.2), com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9 -> S=0.1). The Stable Dependencies Principle requires a package to depend only on packages more stable than itself (lower S). All outgoing dependencies have substantially lower S (are more stable) than com.google.gson.metrics. Although com.google.gson.metrics has Ca=0 (making it inherently unstable), it does not depend on less stable packages. Therefore no Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

The analyzed package has Ce=1 and Ca=0 => instability I = 1.0 (very unstable). Its only outgoing dependency is com.google.gson with Ce=5 and Ca=12 => instability I ≈ 0.294 (more stable). Since the package depends on a more stable package (I_dependent > I_dependency) and has no incoming dependencies, it does not violate the Stable Dependencies Principle; therefore Unstable Dependency is not detected.

com.google.gson.stream has Ce=2 and Ca=8 (stability S = 8/(8+2) = 0.80). Its outgoing dependencies are: com.google.gson (Ce=5, Ca=12, S = 12/(12+5) ≈ 0.706) and com.google.gson.internal (Ce=5, Ca=6, S = 6/(6+5) ≈ 0.545). Both outgoing dependencies have lower stability than com.google.gson.stream, so com.google.gson.stream depends on less stable components, violating the Stable Dependencies Principle. Incoming dependency metrics (Ca=8) also indicate com.google.gson.stream is relatively stable, reinforcing that depending on the less stable packages above constitutes an Unstable Dependency smell.

com.google.gson has Ce=5, Ca=12 => stability I=12/(12+5)=0.706 (relatively stable). It has outgoing dependencies to: com.google.gson.internal.sql (Ce=3, Ca=1 => I=0.25), com.google.gson.internal (Ce=5, Ca=6 => I=0.545), com.google.gson.internal.bind (Ce=6, Ca=2 => I=0.25), com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9 => I=0.90), com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8 => I=0.80). Because com.google.gson (I=0.706) depends on several packages with lower stability (internal.sql I=0.25, internal I=0.545, internal.bind I=0.25), it violates the Stable Dependencies Principle. Incoming dependency count (Ca=12) indicates com.google.gson is relatively stable and therefore should not depend on these less stable packages—hence an Unstable Dependency smell is detected.

It has an outgoing dependency to com.google.gson.internal (Ce=5, Ca=6 => I = 5/(5+6) ≈ 0.45), which is less stable (higher instability) than com.google.gson.reflect. Multiple incoming dependents (Ca=9) — e.g. com.google.gson.metrics, com.google.gson, com.google.gson.internal, com.google.gson.internal.sql, com.google.gson.internal.bind, com.google.gson.typeadapters, com.google.gson.interceptors, com.google.gson.graph, com.example — indicate com.google.gson.reflect is relatively stable and therefore should not depend on a more unstable package.
